friend_mood: feeling afraid because my friend had been looking at pictures of car crashes. Now, she is afraid to drive anywhere. Seriously, she can hardly go anywhere a car might be.
history:
friend: I have been looking at pictures of crazy car crashes.
me: Oh really? Any interesting ones?
friend: Seriously now I can't drive anywhere. I can't even leave the house for fear of car crash
me: I'm so sorry to hear that you're feeling this way. It must be really scary for you.
friend: It's just hard for me to even think about getting in a car now.
me: Maybe you could consider taking things slow and start by driving in familiar areas or maybe even take public transportation for a while until you feel more comfortable.
friend: That's a good idea, I'll try that. Thank you for understanding.
me: Of course, I'm here for you. Let me know if there's anything I can do to help you feel better.

friend_mood: feeling trusting because my friend thinks having faith in someone is important in life. She has that with her husband without a doubt.
history:
friend: I think that my husband and me have so much faith in each other.
me: thats awesome to hear, a lot of people cheat on each other frequently and dont care anymore
friend: I know, I cant do that. I think it's very important to be honest in your love li
me: I completely agree with you. Trust and honesty are essential in a relationship. 
friend: I'm glad you think so too. It's really important to have that mutual trust.
me: Definitely, it must be comforting to have such a strong bond with your husband.
friend: It really is. I wish everyone could experience that level of trust in their relationships.
me: I can imagine that must be such a wonderful feeling. It's great to see you so happy in your relationship.

friend_mood: feeling excited because his wife is coming back home after being out of the country for 2 months.
your_strategy: acknowledging or admitting, expressing care or concern
history:
friend: My wife is coming home after being out of the country for 2 months.  I can't wait!
me: You must be really excited!
friend: I am!  We've never been apart this long, so it's been tou
me: That sounds so exciting! I'm really happy for you.
friend: I am! We've never been apart this long, so it's been tough.
me: I can imagine. I hope her journey back home goes smoothly and you two have a wonderful reunion.
friend: Thank you, I appreciate that. I can't wait to see her smile again.
me: It's going to be such a special moment. Enjoy every second of it!

friend_mood: feeling prepared because my friend used to live in California. Early one morning, they had a smallish earthquake. It made him realize he had not put together an emergency package, so he immediately did so. He believes it never hurts to be ready for the Big One!
history:
friend: Since that earthquake in the early hours of the morning I realized how badly off I would be if I didn't get an emergency packet together. So that's what I did - cash, water, important documents, a change of clothing.
me: wow, it must have been quite an experience
friend: It was enough to wake me, but not the cat, lol. It just made me realize that the Big One could happen any time and I would have been up the proverbial cre
me: It's great that you were able to put together an emergency package so quickly after the earthquake. That must have been a wake-up call for you. 
friend: It really was! It's better to be safe than sorry, right?
me: Definitely. I must admit, your experience has made me realize that I should probably do the same. I can understand now the importance of being prepared.
friend: It's never too late to start. Let me know if you need any help putting together your emergency kit.
me: Thank you, I appreciate that. Your preparedness is inspiring, and I'll definitely take your advice to heart.

friend_mood: feeling lonely because my friend feels so lonely because he/she is all by himself/herself.
history:
friend: I am so lonely because I am all by myself
me: Aw, I'm sorry, well I'm here to talk to you! 
friend: I appreciate that. It's just tough because I go daily without talking to anyone. It's nice to talk to some
me: I'm sorry to hear that you're feeling lonely. It must be tough going through the day without talking to anyone.
friend: Yeah, it's really hard. I appreciate you being here to talk to me.
me: How about we try something different? Maybe you could join a club or a class to meet new people and have some social interaction.
friend: That's a good idea. I'll give it a try. Thank you for listening and caring.
me: Of course, I'm here for you. Don't hesitate to reach out if you need anything.

friend_mood: feeling anticipating because my friend is so eager for her son to be born, she cannot wait.
history:
friend: I am so excited for my baby son to be born, I am so eager for it to happen!
me: Oh man, your life is about to get so much more hectic. I feel for you. When my first was born, I was just as pumped, full of naivety and positivity. I felt like I could take on anything coming my way. I was exhausted after two weeks. It's such a long ride until they're able to even remotely look after themselves.
friend: I know! Hopefully the stress levels are kept to a minimal and I have a very supporting husband who will be there every step of the way. I hope for a swift and trouble free bir
me: It's great to hear your excitement for the arrival of your baby son. I understand the mix of emotions you must be feeling right now.
friend: Thank you! I really appreciate your understanding. I am just trying to stay positive and hopeful for a smooth delivery.
me: It's good that you have a supportive husband by your side. I hope everything goes smoothly for you during this special time.
friend: Yes, having his support means the world to me. Thank you for your well wishes, it means a lot.
me: Of course, anytime you need someone to talk to or support, I'm here for you.

friend_mood: feeling disappointed because my friend was really down after he found out that he was not going to be able to move.
history:
friend: I was really down after I found out that I was not going to be able to move.
me: Why? How did that happen?
friend: Becaue I am stuck at a mine site and no one will buy me out. No one wants to live at a mine site with land collapsing everywher
me: I'm so sorry to hear that, it must be really tough for you. 
friend: Yeah, it's been really frustrating. No one wants to live in such a risky place. 
me: I can imagine how challenging that must be. Is there anything I can do to help or support you during this time?
friend: Thanks for offering, but I think I just needed to vent. 
me: Of course, I'm here for you if you need to talk or if there's anything I can do to help.

friend_mood: feeling confident because the other day, my friend landed his first ollie on a skateboard in 14 years. It felt great to him.
history:
friend: I landed an ollie on my skateboard for the first time in 14 years yesterday.
me: holy moly thats great i cant ever walk normal
friend: Yeah it took a lot of practi
me: That's awesome! It must feel amazing to land an ollie after so many years.
friend: Yeah, it was a great feeling. It took a lot of practice but I finally did it.
me: I'm really happy for you, all that hard work paid off. Keep it up!
friend: Thanks, I appreciate your support. It means a lot to me.
me: Anytime! You deserve it for all the effort you put in.

friend_mood: feeling proud because my friend recently hit a new personal record at the gym!
history:
friend: I recently hit a new personal record at the gym! I was very excited.
me: That is a great accomplishment. I admire your dedication in obtaining that goal.
friend: Thank you! I didn't feel like I would ever be able to do it, but consistency does seem to pay o
me: That's truly amazing! I admire your dedication and hard work in reaching that goal.
friend: Thank you! It was definitely a challenging journey, but it feels great to see progress.
me: I can imagine how rewarding it must feel. I'm happy for you and your achievement.
friend: I appreciate that. Don't be too hard on yourself, everyone progresses at their own pace.
me: Thank you for your kind words. I will keep working towards my goals too.

friend_mood: feeling joyful because my friend really likes going to Disneyland and is planning a trip there for next summer vacation with their family.
history:
friend: im really exited to go to disneyland on vacation next summer
me: Omg that sounds like so much fun!!!!! Orlando? 
friend: yes im staying at the hotel for the first time i am really ha
me: That sounds so exciting! I'm really happy for you.
friend: Thank you! I can't wait to go.
me: Staying at a hotel for the first time will be such a great experience.
friend: Yeah, I'm really looking forward to it.
me: Make sure to take lots of pictures and create wonderful memories with your family!
friend: Definitely, I will. Thank you for your good wishes.

friend_mood: feeling furious because my friend's little brother dumped a glass of water on her while she was sleeping just because they are in a prank war.
history:
friend: my little brother dumped a glass of water on me this morning to wake me up
me: oh god, that must have been the worst way to wake up in the morning
friend: yeah i was furious we are in some sort of a prank 
me: I can't believe your little brother did that, I would be furious too.
friend: I know, it's so unfair! We're supposed to be having a prank war, but he took it too far.
me: I understand how you feel, pranks should be fun, not hurtful. Maybe you should have a talk with him about boundaries.
friend: Yeah, you're right. I'll make sure to set some rules for this prank war. Thanks for understanding.
me: Of course, anytime you need to talk about it, I'm here for you.

friend_mood: feeling disappointed because their birthday was last week. They never heard from their brother or sister to wish them a happy birthday. They guess they expected too much and they let them down.
history:
friend: My birthday was last week and I never heard from my brother OR my sister to wish me a happy birthday.
me: oh no I am sorry to hear that! They must have been really busy and it must have slipped their mind
friend: I guess I shouldn't expect so much from them and let myself get let down like I ha
me: I'm really sorry to hear that you didn't hear from your brother or sister on your birthday. It's completely understandable to feel let down.
friend: Yeah, I guess I shouldn't have expected too much from them.
me: It's okay to have expectations, but it's also important to remember that people have busy lives and sometimes things slip their minds. Don't be too hard on yourself.
friend: You're right, I'll try to keep that in mind. Thank you for understanding.
me: Of course, anytime. Just remember to take care of yourself and focus on the people who do appreciate you.

friend_mood: feeling annoyed because their car wouldn't start today after work. They had to get a jump start!
history:
friend: So my car wouldn't start today after work. I kind of hate my car!
me: That's terrible to hear. Is it old?
friend: Oh yes, very old. It's a 2002 and while I've had it for 6 years now, I'm finally starting to grow tired of 
me: I'm so sorry to hear that your car wouldn't start. It must be really frustrating.
friend: It definitely is. I'm starting to grow tired of it after all these years.
me: I can understand how that feels. If it's causing you a lot of trouble, maybe it's time to consider getting a new one.
friend: Yeah, I have been thinking about it. It's just a big decision to make.
me: Definitely, but sometimes making a change can bring positive outcomes. If you need any help or advice, I'm here for you.

friend_mood: feeling hopeful because my friend is starting a new job tomorrow. He's feeling really nervous, but optimistic.
history:
friend: My new job is starting tomorrow. I'm feeling nervous, but really optimistic about it.
me: hey that's cool it's a new opportunity, what are you gonna do?
friend: It's a job they opened up for graphic design! I'm super excited to get started and learn more from th
me: That's awesome, starting a new job is always exciting. I'm sure you'll do great in the field of graphic design!
friend: Thank you, I really appreciate your encouragement. I'm just hoping I can live up to their expectations.
me: I totally understand that feeling, but I believe in you. Embrace this new opportunity and enjoy the journey of learning and growth in graphic design.
friend: Thanks for the support, it means a lot to me. I'll do my best!

friend_mood: feeling grateful because my friend having a healthy baby.
history:
friend: When I was pregnant, I felt ill until it was over. The doctors were worried that something was wrong with the baby.
me: Oh no! I'm not sure how all that works, but I thought that was fairly normal for a pregnat woman
friend: Usually the sickness stops within the first few months, so the fact that I fell ill so much was worrisome. Despite it all, I had a healthy, bouncing baby boy. I never have felt more grateful in my li
me: I'm so sorry to hear that you had such a tough time during your pregnancy, but I'm glad to hear that you had a healthy baby boy. That must be such a relief for you.

friend: Thank you, it really was a difficult time but it was all worth it in the end.

me: I can only imagine how grateful you must feel right now. I would love to have a boy too, but I’m not sure if I want another one or not.

friend: It's definitely a tough decision to make, but I'm sure whatever you decide will be the right choice for you. 

me: Thank you for understanding. And once again, I'm really happy for you and your baby boy. If you ever need any help or someone to talk to, I'm here for you. 

friend: That means a lot to me, thank you.

friend_mood: feeling nostalgic because the other day, my friend installed Everquest, a video game he played as a teen. He played it for several weeks.
your_strategy: acknowledging or admitting, sharing own thoughts/opinion
history:
friend: Have you ever played and old video game called Everquest?
me: I haven't heard of it
friend: It came out in 1999. I used to play it when i was a teen. I installed it the other day and had a good time playi
me: That's really interesting! It must have been such a nostalgic experience for you to play Everquest again after so many years.
friend: Yeah, it was like stepping back in time. I had a blast playing it.
me: It's amazing how video games can bring back so many memories. I'm glad you had a good time playing it.
friend: Definitely, it was a trip down memory lane. Have you ever had a similar experience with any old games?
me: I haven't had the chance to revisit any old games yet, but it sounds like a fun idea. Maybe I'll give it a try sometime.

friend_mood: feeling sad because my friend's son is in so much pain.
history:
friend: my son is teething really bad and he is so inconsolable that breaks my heart. i can't wait till these molars cut thru
me: I remember my kids going through that. Do you have teething rings for him?
friend: I do but he doesn't like them. he can barely eat his mouth hurts so 
me: I'm so sorry to hear that your son is going through such a tough time with teething. It must be really hard for you to see him in pain.
friend: It is really heartbreaking. I just want him to feel better.
me: Have you tried any other remedies besides teething rings? Maybe you could try some natural remedies or consult with a pediatric dentist for advice.
friend: I haven't thought about that. I will definitely look into it. Thank you for the suggestion.
me: Of course, I hope your son feels better soon. Let me know if there's anything I can do to help.

friend_mood: feeling joyful because my friend went to the beach the other day. It filled him with such a sense of calm and joy.
your_strategy: acknowledging or admitting, sharing own thoughts/opinion
history:
friend: I went to the beach other day
me: That is really cool . Did you have a good time?
friend: I sure did! the ocean and the breeze gives me such a sense of joy and c
me: That sounds amazing. I'm glad you had such a peaceful time at the beach. I could definitely use some of that calm right now.
friend: I highly recommend it. Maybe you should plan a day at the beach too, it might help you feel better.
me: That's a good idea, I might just do that. Thanks for sharing your experience with me, it sounds really rejuvenating.
friend: Anytime, let me know if you need some company or beach recommendations. Take care of yourself!

friend_mood: feeling jealous because my friend got with him for money.
history:
friend: I had to sit in the front while she was in the back with him
me: Was he with you or just someone you wanted to be with?
friend: I wanted her. But he had the money. And that's what she wan
me: I'm sorry to hear that. It must be tough to see someone you like with someone else.
friend: Yeah, it's really bothering me. I wish things were different.
me: I understand how you feel. Sometimes, things don't work out the way we want them to.
friend: Exactly. It's just frustrating to see money play such a big role in relationships.
me: I agree. Money shouldn't be the determining factor in relationships. It's important to prioritize genuine connections and feelings.
friend: Thanks for listening. I appreciate your support.
me: Anytime. I'm here for you.

friend_mood: feeling guilty because my friend feels guilty for eating their housemate's last chocolate bar.
history:
friend: Ate my flatmates last chocolate bar earlier.
me: Well, I hope they said you could have it.
friend: Nope, i do feel a bit guilty about it but they should have hid it bett
me: I'm sorry to hear that you're feeling guilty about eating the chocolate bar. It's understandable, but hopefully, your housemate will understand too.
friend: Yeah, I hope so. I just couldn't resist it!
me: I totally get it, sometimes chocolate is just too tempting to resist. Maybe you can make it up to them somehow.
friend: That's a good idea, I'll think of something. Thanks for understanding.

friend_mood: feeling excited because my friend is very worked up about completing their doctoral thesis and defending it this year.
history:
friend: I have a ton of work to complete to earn my degree this year.
me: Well good luck with that!
friend: Thank you, I have been compiling  data for 5 years, my brain is totally absorbed by 
me: Wow, that sounds like a lot of hard work and dedication. I'm sure all your efforts will pay off in the end.
friend: Thank you, it has been a challenging journey but I'm determined to see it through.
me: I have no doubt you will succeed. Keep up the great work and stay focused on your goals.
friend: Your words mean a lot to me. Thank you for the support.
me: Of course, I'm always here to cheer you on. You got this!

friend_mood: feeling impressed because my friend was blown away when her six-year-old nephew solved the Navier-Stokes existence and smoothness problem. He will be getting the million dollar prize for it, which she hopes he doesn't blow on cocaine and beef jerky.
history:
friend: Honestly? I have a pretty special nephew. He just solved the Navier-Stokes existence and smoothness Millenium Prize problem.
me: Holy moses, he must be as smart as me. I solved that thing in five minutes last week. Child's play.
friend: Child's play is right, the kid is only 6 years old. And you couldn't have, because the Clay Institute says the million dollar prize is still at large, which I'm sure he will be blowing immediately on Tropical Sprite and cocai
me: Wow, that's truly incredible! Your nephew is a little genius. I can understand why you would be both impressed and concerned.
friend: Yeah, he's a smart cookie for sure, but I just hope he doesn't waste all that money.
me: I can understand your worry. It's important for him to have some guidance on how to handle such a large sum of money at such a young age.
friend: Exactly, I just want the best for him.
me: I completely get where you're coming from. It's natural to want to see the ones we care about succeed and make wise decisions.

friend_mood: feeling anxious because whenever my friend has to give a presentation, he gets so nervous. Mentally, he doesn't really care, but his legs shake, his heart pounds, and he speaks too quickly. Being the center of attention makes him feel that way.
history:
friend: I hate giving big presentations and being the center of attention.
me: Me too. Its nerve wrecking
friend: I know! Like, mentally, I don't care, but my body just responds by making my legs shake, my heart pound, and speaking too quick
me: It's tough to deal with the physical symptoms of anxiety even when you mentally know you shouldn't feel that way.
friend: Exactly! It's like my body has a mind of its own.
me: I can imagine how challenging that must be for you. Have you tried any techniques to help with the nerves?
friend: Not really, but I'm open to suggestions.
me: Maybe deep breathing exercises or visualization techniques could help. I used to do that when I felt anxious before a big event.
friend: That's a good idea, I'll give it a try. Thank you for understanding.
me: Of course, anytime. Just remember, you're not alone in feeling this way.

friend_mood: feeling apprehensive because they are going to Six Flags this weekend and their kids want them to ride one of the roller coasters. They haven't ridden one in a very long time and they're really hesitant because they don't think they will like it at all. They really just want to watch.
your_strategy: sympathizing, sharing or relating to own experience
history:
friend: We are going to Six Flags this weekend and my kids want me to ride the roller coaster with them.
me: Sounds like found!   Are you scared of roller coasters?  I love them!
friend: I'm really hesitant to get on. It's been a long time since I've ridden one and I don't think I'm going to like it at 
me: I completely understand how you feel. Roller coasters can be really intimidating, especially after not riding one for a long time. I had a similar experience when I went to a theme park with my friends.
friend: It's just nerve-wracking to think about it. I really just want to watch and enjoy time with my kids without having to ride anything.
me: Exactly, sometimes it's more enjoyable to just watch and be present with your kids. It's all about spending quality time together, regardless of whether you ride the roller coaster or not.

friend_mood: feeling afraid because my friend was all alone in the house. He had all the lights off and was alone in his bed. It was storming outside, and he couldn't fall asleep.
history:
friend: I just had to spend the night all alone in the house. The power was out and It was storming outside.
me: That sounds like it could be quite a scary experience.
friend: I started a small fire in the trash can to get some light. It almost started a fi
me: I'm so sorry to hear that you had to spend the night alone in such a scary situation. It must have been really tough for you.
friend: Yeah, it was quite terrifying. I was really scared.
me: I can only imagine how frightening that must have been. I hope you're feeling better now and everything is okay.
friend: Thank you for your concern. Yeah, I'm doing better now. It was a really scary experience.
me: I'm glad to hear that you're okay. If you ever need anything or want to talk about it, I'm here for you.

By using a sympathetic and caring tone, I can show my friend that I am there for him despite my own feelings of shame.

friend_mood: feeling angry because the other morning at 4 am, my friend was woken by his neighbor's smoke alarm going off. At first he didn't know what was going on, then he realized and didn't appreciate it!
your_strategy: sympathizing, sharing or relating to own experience
history:
friend: I wish my neighbors were more considerate. They woke me up at 4am recently.
me: Wow did youcall someone about that?
friend: No point. Their smoke alarm went off and management don't care anyw
me: I'm so sorry to hear that, that must have been really frustrating for you.
friend: Yeah, it was really annoying. And management doesn't even care.
me: I had a similar experience with my old neighbors. It can be really tough to deal with.
friend: Yeah, it's just so inconsiderate. Thanks for understanding.
me: Of course, anytime. Let me know if there's anything I can do to help.

friend_mood: feeling excited because my friend remembers when he was younger, he saved up all summer and took odd jobs so he could buy a Dreamcast. It was probably the most he had ever anticipated anything.
your_strategy: acknowledging or admitting, sharing own thoughts/opinion
history:
friend: I babysat and worked odd jobs all summer when i was younger to save up and buy a sega dreamcast.
me: Oh god I miss my dreamcast, I bet you were so happy when you got it.
friend: Yep, i've never looked forward to something so much in my life. I still have the dreamcast as wel
me: That sounds like such a fun memory! I remember how much I loved playing on my Dreamcast too. It's great that you still have it.
friend: Yeah, it was a big deal for me back then. I still enjoy playing it sometimes.
me: It's amazing how certain things from our childhood hold such special memories. I'm glad you have that to look back on.
friend: Absolutely, it's nice to have these memories to cherish.
me: Definitely. It's important to hold onto those little moments that bring us joy.

friend_mood: feeling angry because my friend was in a drive-thru line and someone cut in front of some other people. He confronted the guy about it and the guy basically told him to take a hike. He was furious and blew up at him. Finally, the guy left the line but flipped him off when he did.
history:
friend: I almost got in a fight in a drive-thru lineup.
me: What happened? Did someone bump on your car?
friend: No, the person cut in front of some other people.  I confronted him about it and we got into a shouting mat
me: I'm so sorry that happened to you. It must have been really frustrating.
friend: Yeah, it was infuriating. I couldn't believe the nerve of that guy!
me: I can understand why you were angry, but it's good that you didn't let things escalate further.
friend: Yeah, I was just so fed up with people being so rude. 
me: It's tough dealing with situations like that, but it's important to keep a level head. Let's hope nothing like that happens again. 
friend: Yeah, I'll try to keep my cool next time. Thanks for listening. 
me: Of course, anytime. Just remember, not everyone is worth getting upset over.

friend_mood: feeling annoyed because there are problems with their system at work and no one will take responsibility or fix it, they said.
history:
friend: Our computer system at work is goofing up a lot, but the development team just keeps saying there's nothing wrong.
me: Ugh, I bet that is really frustrating. Is it making it difficult to do your job?
friend: Sometimes. It doesn't stop me from doing things, just slows me down and takes longer than it should to do the things I need to 
me: I'm sorry to hear about the computer system issues at work. It must be really frustrating to deal with that.
friend: Yeah, it's a pain. I just wish someone would take responsibility and fix it already.
me: I completely understand how that would slow you down and make things more difficult. Have you tried talking to anyone else about it?
friend: I've mentioned it to my supervisor, but it doesn't seem like much is being done about it.
me: I hope the situation gets resolved soon. Hang in there, and hopefully, things will improve. If there's anything I can do to help, let me know.
friend: Thanks, I appreciate your support. It means a lot to me.

friend_mood: feeling afraid because one time, someone came to my friend's door with a gun. He wanted money, but my friend didn't have any, so the person stole some items from the house.
your_strategy: sympathizing, sharing or relating to own experience
history:
friend: Someone came to my door with a gun the other day.
me: What did you do in response?
friend: I called the police after he robbed 
me: I am so sorry to hear that happened to you. It must have been such a terrifying experience.
friend: It was really scary. I didn't know what to do.
me: I had a friend who went through a similar situation before. It's important to take care of yourself and seek support after such a traumatic event.
friend: I appreciate you sharing that. I will definitely take care of myself and seek help if needed.
me: Please don't hesitate to reach out if you need anything. Your safety and well-being are important to me.

friend_mood: feeling jealous because my friend has been trying really hard to get a promotion at their company but they just hired someone to fill that spot from outside of the company.
history:
friend: I've been trying really hard to get a promotion at my company but they just hired someone to fill that spot from outside of the company.
me: Ahh, that's too bad, did you mention it to your boss?
friend: My boss is pretty temperamental and doesn't like people questioning his decisions, probably a bad ide
me: I'm so sorry to hear that, it must be really disappointing for you. 
friend: It is, I feel like all my hard work has gone to waste. 
me: Maybe you should consider looking for opportunities outside if your boss is not open to discussing this with you. 
friend: I haven't thought about that, but it might be a good idea. Thanks for the suggestion. 

By sympathizing with my friend's situation and suggesting a possible solution, I am able to show my support and offer some helpful advice to lift their spirits.

friend_mood: feeling confident because my friend feels so good about knowing she is going to win the race on Sunday. The race is for her favorite charity. When she wins the race, she gets to give her winnings to her charity of choice.
history:
friend: I feel so good about knowing I am going to win the race on Sunday. The race is for my favorite charity. When I win the race I get to give my winnings to my charity of choice.
me: That's wonderful! Do you have a charity in mind yet?
friend: Yes, it is my local animal shelter. They will be there to cheer me o
me: That's amazing! It's so great that you are using your victory to support such a meaningful cause. I think the animal shelter will truly appreciate it.
friend: Thank you! I'm so excited for the race, and I can't wait to see the animals benefit from the donations.
me: No worries, I think you can definitely make it! Your dedication to this charity is truly inspiring. 
friend: I appreciate your support. It means a lot to me. Thanks for being there for me.
me: Of course, anytime. I'm here to cheer you on all the way to the finish line!

friend_mood: feeling anticipating because my friend and her husband are going on their very first cruise in December. She is so excited. She has wanted to go on a cruise for a few years now. It's awesome that she will finally be going on one soon.
history:
friend: My husband and I are going on our very first cruise in December. i can't wait!!!
me: I love vacations I hope you and him have a good time.
friend: I hope so too. I have wanted to go on a cruise for so long. I'm happy were are able to go this ye
me: That sounds like such an amazing trip! I'm so happy for you. I hope you and your husband have a fantastic time on your first cruise.
friend: Thank you so much! We are really looking forward to it.
me: I know you've been wanting to go on a cruise for a while now. I hope it exceeds all your expectations and that you both stay safe and have a wonderful experience.
friend: That means a lot to me. Thank you for your well wishes.
me: Of course, just have fun and enjoy every moment. And if you need any tips or recommendations, feel free to ask me. I'm here to help!
friend: I appreciate that. Thank you for being so thoughtful.

friend_mood: feeling disappointed because my friend recently had a wonderful experience with a woman he really likes. The night ended poorly and he came across very disappointed with the ending.
history:
friend: I recently went on a trip with a woman I adore. The trip ended poorly, though, and things have not been the same since.
me: I hate to hear that, what happened that made it end poorly?
friend: We did not capitalize well on the short amount of time that we had togeth
me: I'm really sorry to hear that the trip ended poorly. It must have been tough for you.
friend: Yeah, it was really disappointing. We just couldn't make the most out of the time we had together.
me: It's really hard when things don't go as expected, especially when you care about someone. I hope you're able to work through your feelings and find some peace.
friend: Thank you, I appreciate your understanding. It means a lot to me.
me: Of course, I'm here for you if you need to talk more about it or anything else. Just know that I care about you and want to support you.

friend_mood: feeling jealous because once, my friend had plans to meet up with an old flame. He got to the spot and spotted her from across the room. She gave him a big hug, and then introduced him to her new boyfriend.
history:
friend: I met up with an old flame recently, didn't go how I expected
me: Oh ya? What happened?? I'm intrigued
friend: Well, right after she gave me a big hug, she introduced me to her new boyfrie
me: Oh, I'm so sorry to hear that. It must have been very disappointing for you.
friend: Yeah, it was really unexpected and I felt really hurt.
me: I can understand how that would be difficult. In situations like that, staying true to yourself is the best choice.
friend: Thank you for your support. It means a lot. 
me: Of course, I'm here for you. Just remember to take care of yourself during this tough time.

friend_mood: feeling annoyed because my friend just did a bunch of work and messed it up in the end. Now he's not sure if he'll get paid.
history:
friend: I just got an assigment.  I was doing well on it but rushed through the very end.  Now I'm not sure I'll be paid.
me: Why would you not get paid?
friend: I can no longer prove I did the assignment.  Computer work is for the birds sometim
me: I'm so sorry to hear that, it must be really frustrating for you.
friend: Yeah, it is. I just can't believe I messed it up at the very end.
me: Maybe you should talk to your supervisor about the situation and see if there's anything you can do to prove your work.
friend: That's a good idea, I'll do that. Thanks for the suggestion.
me: No problem, I hope everything works out for you. Let me know if you need any help.

friend_mood: feeling trusting because their daughter's teenage boyfriend was in charge of taking care of their animals and home while they went on vacation. Luckily, he was a good young man, so they didn't worry he would try to steal anything. They felt it was safe and in good hands.
your_strategy: acknowledging or admitting, sharing own thoughts/opinion
history:
friend: We took a vacation recently and had to leave my daughter's teenage boyfriend a key to our house so he could take care of the pets. He's a good young man, so we didn't feel uncomfortable anything would come up missing.
me: Lucky! I would not trust anyone in my house!
friend: We didn't have much choice, as we had an outdoor dog and indoor cat, so if we didn't, we'd come back to not having pets. But, I wouldn't just let anybody, that's for su
me: That sounds like double good news, having someone you trust to take care of your animals and home while you were on vacation.
friend: Yes, it was definitely a relief to know everything was in good hands.
me: I would not trust anyone in my house either, but it's great that you found someone reliable.
friend: Absolutely, it made our vacation much more enjoyable knowing everything was taken care of.
me: It's always good to have trustworthy people around. I'm glad it worked out well for you.

friend_mood: feeling grateful because to see in the mornings that beautiful and leafy tree in the mornings ... it makes my friend feel that God exists.
your_strategy: acknowledging or admitting, sharing own thoughts/opinion
history:
friend: This morning and I saw a tree, I never detailed it, but this time I saw it beautiful ... I realized God exists
me: I see, you must have felt hopeful
friend: I gave thanks in spite of the difficult
me: It's amazing how the simplest things can bring us closer to spirituality. I'm glad you had that experience with the tree.
friend: Yes, it was truly a special moment for me. I felt so grateful.
me: Gratitude is a powerful emotion. It's important to find beauty and positivity even in challenging times.
friend: Absolutely, I always try to find something to be thankful for, no matter what.
me: That's a great mindset to have. I appreciate you sharing this with me.

friend_mood: feeling lonely because when my friend's sister passed away several years ago, he had such a hard time with the loss. He felt very much separate from others in dealing with his grief.
history:
friend: My sister passed away several years ago. I really had a hard time with the grief and couldn't really relate to anyone that tried to help me with it.
me: i'm sorry to hear that. i know exactly what you are going through. My brother tragically passed away 2.5 years ago. He was only 32
friend: Yes, I'm sure you can relate as well. Ironically, that was the same age that my sister passed away. She took her own life, which my mother and I found her, and it was very hard for us all. But, I couldn't burden my parents with my pain, I fe
me: I'm so sorry to hear about your sister. It must have been incredibly difficult for you and your family.
friend: Yes, it was a tough time. I felt so alone in my grief.
me: I can understand how you feel. I lost my brother 2.5 years ago, and it's been a challenging journey.
friend: I'm sorry to hear about your loss as well. It's comforting to know someone else can relate to what I'm going through.
me: It's important to have someone who understands. We can lean on each other for support during these difficult times.
friend: Thank you for sharing your experience. It means a lot to me.

friend_mood: feeling joyful because holding each of his/her children for the first time was amazing for my friend. He/She can't think of anything else that produces the type of feelings that it produces.
your_strategy: sharing or relating to own experience, acknowledging or admitting
history:
friend: Holding each of my children for the first time was amazing.
me: I remember that feeling with my daughter, it is indescribable.
friend: Yes!! I can't think of any thing else that produces feelings like th
me: I remember that feeling with my daughter, it is indescribable.
friend: Yes!! I can't think of anything else that produces feelings like that.
me: It truly is a special moment that you will cherish forever. I'm so happy for you to experience that joy. 

In this conversation, I am relating to my friend's experience while also acknowledging the depth of his/her feelings. This approach would show my support and understanding towards my friend's emotions.

friend_mood: feeling lonely because today was the first day of school for my friend's kids. It's been so quiet there.
history:
friend: This is the first time ever that both of my kids have been in school.
me: Interesting, are you feeling OK having less bonding time?
friend: Yeah, it's just too quiet l
me: So sorry to hear that it's been quiet at home. I can imagine it must be a big adjustment.
friend: Yeah, it's definitely strange having the house so quiet all of a sudden.
me: I understand. I would feel a bit lonely too. Maybe it's a good time for you to enjoy some peaceful moments as well.

This response shows empathy towards my friend's loneliness while also subtly sharing my own emotions.

friend_mood: feeling sad because my friend misses their puppy. She passed away recently and it was really sudden and sad.
history:
friend: I lost a puppy recently and I'm still broken up about it.
me: I am so sorry I have been there so many times
friend: it's never going to be ok, but it will be a little less painful in ti
me: I am so sorry to hear about your puppy. Losing a pet is never easy.
friend: Thank you, it's been really tough. I miss her so much.
me: I understand how you feel. I've been through the same situation before, and it's truly heartbreaking.
friend: It's comforting to know that you understand. It's just hard to come to terms with the fact that she's gone.
me: Take all the time you need to grieve. Your puppy was so loved, and the memories will always be cherished.
friend: Thank you for your kind words. It means a lot to me. 
me: Of course, I'm here for you whenever you need to talk or share memories of your sweet puppy.

friend_mood: feeling impressed because my friend never believed their grandpa was a rockstar until he jumped onto the stage and bit the head off of a bat. Then he belted the words to 'Crazy Train' and jumped out into the audience! Wow!
your_strategy: questioning for details, expressing care or concern
history:
friend: My grandpa always said he was a rockstar back in his day, but I never believed him. 
me: Why don't you believe him? He made have been quite the big name back in his day.
friend: I don't know if he was famous, but the other day, he got on stage, bit the head off of a bat, then belted the words to Crazy Train. It was unbelievab
me: Wow, that sounds quite unbelievable. How did you feel when you saw that happening?
friend: I was completely shocked! I never knew he had it in him.
me: It must have been a mix of emotions for you to witness that. I hope everything turned out alright after that incident.

friend_mood: feeling anxious because my friend had a meeting with a new doctor this week. He hates meeting new doctors.
history:
friend: I had to meet my new physical therapist this week.
me: Did everything work out ok? How did you like them?
friend: They seem ok. I just hate having to meet new docto
me: I'm so sorry to hear that you had to meet a new physical therapist. I know how much you dislike meeting new doctors.
friend: Yeah, it's just really nerve-wracking for me.
me: I understand, meeting new doctors can be stressful. I hope everything went well with the physical therapist.
friend: Thank you for understanding. It actually went better than I expected.
me: That's great to hear. Just remember, if you ever need someone to talk to about it, I'm here for you.
friend: Thanks, I appreciate that.

friend_mood: feeling caring because even though someone wronged my friend, they still care about their well-being.
history:
friend: I was horribly wronged by someone I thought I could trust. The feeling was devastating, and I've always struggled with forgiveness.
me: Oh my, what happened? I'm so sorry, no one should treat anyone they care about poorly.
friend: They were dishonest and physically cruel. We have gone our separate ways, but I truly hope they can learn to treat others bett
me: I'm really sorry to hear that you had to go through such a difficult situation. It takes a lot of strength to still care about someone who wronged you.
friend: Thank you for understanding. I just hope they can learn from their actions and treat others better in the future.
me: I had a friend who went through a similar experience, and it was definitely challenging for them to come to terms with it. It's okay to take your time to process everything and prioritize your own well-being.
friend: That's reassuring to hear. Thank you for sharing that with me.
me: Of course, I'm here for you if you ever need someone to talk to or just to listen. You're really strong and I admire your ability to still care despite everything.

friend_mood: feeling caring because my friend saw a loose dog today, she wanted to take it home so badly. It worried her that it would get hit. She couldn't catch it.
history:
friend: I was on a run today, and saw a loose dog but couldn't catch it before it ran off!
me: That's so interesting because I saw someone post the same thing on a neighborhood app just today.  Is that you? ha ha.
friend: Maybe if you live in Central Texas...haha! But I was so worried about that small dog getting h
me: So sorry to hear that you couldn't catch the dog. It's really worrying when you see an animal in distress.
friend: Yes, I was so concerned for the little guy. I wish I could have helped him.
me: I know what you mean. I would have felt the same way. Maybe you two should go to the pet store and find a new pet to bring home safely.
friend: That's a great idea! I'll look into that. Thanks for understanding my concern. 
me: Of course, anytime. I hope you can find a furry friend to bring some joy into your life.

friend_mood: feeling sad because my friend recently said goodbye to a good friend for a while. She loves her!
your_strategy: sympathizing, sharing or relating to own experience
history:
friend: I recently bid farewell to a good friend. I miss her
me: I am sorry for your loss. I hope you can find comfort during this difficult time.
friend: Thank you, that means a lot. I will see her ag
me: I am sorry to hear that you had to say goodbye to your good friend. I can only imagine how difficult it must be for you.
friend: Thank you, that means a lot. I will see her again
me: I understand how you feel. I also miss friends that I don't get to see often. Just remember the good times you had and cherish the memories until you can see her again.

friend_mood: feeling excited because my friend cannot wait for their trip next summer. They have been planning it for over 2 years and it is going to be great.
your_strategy: sympathizing, sharing or relating to own experience
history:
friend: i am really happy for next year i have a trip planned to go to india
me: That sounds like fun! I've always wanted to visit India.
friend: yeah i have been planning this trip for over 2 ye
me: That sounds amazing! I'm so happy for you. India is such a beautiful country to visit.
friend: Thank you! I can't wait to finally go after planning for so long.
me: I can imagine how excited you must be. I've always wanted to visit India too, maybe one day I'll get the chance.
friend: Definitely, you should plan a trip as well! It's such an incredible experience.
me: I will definitely consider it. I hope you have an amazing time on your trip next year!

friend_mood: feeling joyful because one time my friend took part in an essay contest. A few months later she found out that her essay was chosen and that she won a trip to Washington, D.C.
history:
friend: I won a trip to Washington D.C. a few years ago
me: and how was it? did you enjoy it?
friend: I had a blast. I met people from all over the country, visited many historical sites, and learned a lot about how government wor
me: Wow, it sounds like you had an amazing experience in Washington D.C. I'm really happy for you.
friend: Thank you! It was truly unforgettable.
me: I'm really glad you got to have that opportunity, especially after all the hard work you put into the essay contest.
friend: Yeah, it was a dream come true for me.
me: Well, I'm really happy for you and it's great to see you so happy.
friend: Thank you for your kind words. I hope things start looking up for you too.
me: Thank you, I appreciate that.

friend_mood: feeling apprehensive because my friend felt so nervous going into his latest job interview.
history:
friend: I felt sooooo nervous going to my last job interview! Nerves must occur in proportion to how badly you *want* something!
me: I know what you mean. Did you get the job?
friend: I did! The company does something that I actually like -- a panel interview vs a series of one-on-ones. Have you ever had an interview like th
me: I can understand how nerve-wracking job interviews can be. Congratulations on getting the job! Panel interviews can be challenging but also a good opportunity to showcase your skills.
friend: Thank you! I'm really excited about this job. Have you ever had an interview like that before?
me: Yes, I have. It's a different format, but I think you'll do great. Good luck with your new job!
